cxro.common.device.sensor

Interface Sensor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Device

    public interface Sensor
extends Device
    Interface for Sensor devices.

    This describes a generic interface for single value sensor devices. These can be multichannel devices which provide specific measurement information.

    The channels are numbered 1..size, where size is the number of device channels.
    The channel value is represented as a 64-bit floating point number (F64).
    The measurement type and base units are discoverable.

    REVISION NOTES:
    2016-04-07 : Initial.

    Author:
    Carl Cork <cwcork@lbl.gov>

      • setValue

        void setValue(int channel,
              double value)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Define current measurement value.

        Used to calibrate current measurement value, scaled in base units (see getBaseUnit).

        Parameters:
        channel - Channel number for sensor [1..size].
        value - Scaled measurement value
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occurs (details in message).

      • getValue

        double getValue(int channel)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Get current measurement value.

        This is a double-precision measurement value, scaled in base units (see getBaseUnit).

        Parameters:
        channel - Channel number for sensor [1..size].
        Returns:
        Scaled sensor position.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occurs (details in message).
